newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish Jan-Aug mobile phones sales rise 28.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: Finnish Jan-Aug mobile phones sales rise 28.5 pct.

text.p: Wholesale sales in Finland of mobile phones increased 28.5 percent year-on-year in January-August to 315,800, the Association of Electronics Wholesalers said in a statement on Friday.
For the full year, it expected sales of 495,000 new mobile phones compared to 370,000 in 1995, an official at the association said by telephone.
At the retailing level, the value of mobile phones sales was expected to exceed one billion markka, up some 20-30 percent, despite falling prices, he said.
In 1997, wholesales in Finland of new mobile phones were forecast to increase further to 590,000 units, he said.
Around 80 percent of new mobile handsets being sold were digital GSM (Global System for Mobile Communications) phones, he added.
